page.title: 09WOODSTOCK CARNIVAL
page.content: Woodstock Carnival has been held each year for the past four years. Each year theme is chosen. In previous years themes have been Dragons, Song Titles and the Circus. Lots of people start preparing for the Carnival long before it is held. The Carnival is usually held in the middle of July on a Saturday. Many local groups and charities participate either in the parade or the many stalls. The parade takes a triangular route around Woodstock starting at the Town Hall. All the stalls choose a charity for the proceedings to go to e.g. Heart Foundation, Liver Foundation, Guide Dogs for the Blind. It is a great attraction for the tourists and most of all a great money gainer. A good year will produce 1,500 pounds and even a bad year will make 1,000.
